author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
The dollar's lustre dims as risk grows bold,
Fickle saint Fed leaves rates untold.
Like a wench abandoned at her ale,
All eyes turned to flashing gold.

Fitch comes to judge if Italy's hale,
A tasting of their fiscal ale.
A test of appetites in sight,
Their bonds may yet prevail or fail.

Now Maersk, in this relentless night,
Must cut jobs in its frightful plight.
Where once sailed ships of wealth and mirth,
Now looms the specter of financial blight.

feedItems.title: Risk-On Mood Weighs on Dollar
feedItems.description: The dollar remained under pressure as the risk-on mood continued in global markets after the Fed left interest rates unchanged earlier this week.

feedItems.title: Fitch's Italy Review Next Week Is a Test of Demand for BTP
feedItems.description: Fitch’s review of Italy on Nov. 10 will test appetite for Italian government bonds after the recent spread narrowing, Societe Generale said.

feedItems.title: Maersk to Slash Jobs as Industry Faces New Normal
feedItems.description: Maersk said it will cut more than 10,000 jobs as it steps up cost savings, with the industry facing subdued demand, lower freight rates and inflationary pressure.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In the realm of horse and carriage, BMW doth fair,
A rise in profits and promise steady, we perceive without a care,
Earnings grow, quarter three, in the auto bazaar,
Their guidance full-year, confirms their prosperity near and far.

In lands yonder west of the Mississippi river wide,
Bass Reeves, a lawman black, in freedom, he doth stride,
Quaid, Sutherland and Oyelowo, in Paramount's light, they hide,
Their tale of frontier justice, to entertain, they provide.

Macquarie, strong in capital, of profits, takes a fall,
Yet a buyback bold they plot, answer to the call,
A sum vast in its stature, a billion 'gainst the squall,
Shares of value undeterred, they could claim them all.

feedItems.title: BMW Keeps Forecast as Profits Rise
feedItems.description: BMW confirmed its full-year guidance after underlying earnings in the third quarter rose along with the auto EBIT margin.

feedItems.title: 'Lawmen: Bass Reeves' Review: Freedom on the Frontier
feedItems.description: David Oyelowo plays the first black deputy marshal west of the Mississippi in this sturdy, entertaining series on Paramount+, which also features Dennis Quaid and Donald Sutherland.

feedItems.title: Macquarie to Launch Up to $1.29 Billion Buyback Despite Fall in Profit
feedItems.description: Macquarie Group said first-half net profit fell by 39% but its strong capital position means it could soon begin buying back shares worth up to $1.29 billion.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Upon the land of watches and the white cross,
Swiss Re stands, 'gainst nature's whims no loss.
Their coffers swell from storms' decrease,
To meet their mark, their gold does increase.

In the distant South where the Eucalyptus does reign,
Where Koala and Kangaroo cross the plain.
The shares ascend, the traders' refrain,
In the wake of the rates' abating pain. 

See Italy's ambition rise, bridge of length unmet,
Where wind, and tide, and earth oft threat.
Held high by Vulcan's might and Thor's net,
Connecting lands in a mighty set.

feedItems.title: Swiss Re Outlook on Track After Profit Return
feedItems.description: Swiss Re maintained its profit target for the year of more than $3 billion after lower natural-catastrophe claims helped the insurer swing to a net profit in the third quarter.

feedItems.title: Australia Shares Rise 1.1%, Round Out Weekly Gain
feedItems.description: Australia’s S&P/ASX 200 closed 1.1% higher at 6978.2, completing its strongest weekly gain since early September amid easing interest-rate worries.

feedItems.title: How Italy Plans to Build the World's Longest Suspension Bridge
feedItems.description: Italy’s parliament has approved a plan to build the world’s longest suspension bridge between Sicily and the mainland, an area prone to 170-mph winds, powerful riptides, and earthquakes. WSJ explains the technical plans that may make it feasible.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In yonder grove, where olives gently sway,
A snail's house shattered by hooves gone astray.
Arise, humbled goat, seek well your path,
Lest all vines bear the somber grapes of wrath.

Forensic hounds sniff 'round autumn's cold ash,
Seeking their truth amidst blood's crimson splash.
Exhausted yet tireless, hearts heavy in dread,
Treading lightly, lest they wake the dead.

In brooks of Brooklyn, under darkened moon,
Sudden flurry stirs the rabbit, too soon.
The mayor’s den invaded by stealthy pack,
Ideals and order under swift attack.

feedItems.title: Israel Has Invaded Gaza Before. Here's What Happened.
feedItems.description: Israel has sent ground troops into Gaza to eradicate Hamas, after the militant group launched a surprise assault on Oct. 7. WSJ looks back at Israel’s previous ground offensives into the Palestinian enclave to see what that reveals tells us about the challenges ahead for the Israeli military.

feedItems.title: Israel's Quest to Identify Every Victim of Hamas Leaves Scientists Exhausted, Traumatized
feedItems.description: Forensic specialists have come from around the world to work with the remains of those killed in the Oct. 7 massacre; “it doesn’t stop.”

feedItems.title: FBI agents searched the Brooklyn home of a fundraiser for New York City Mayor Eric Adams, who canceled meetings in Washington to return to New York.
feedItems.description: FBI agents searched the Brooklyn home of a fundraiser for New York City Mayor Eric Adams, who canceled meetings in Washington to return to New York.
